meanings.definition: The state or quality of being complex or intricate.
meanings.sent1: The complicacy of the puzzle made it challenging to solve.
meanings.sent2: The complicacy of the situation required careful analysis.
meanings.sent3: The complicacy of the recipe led to a hilarious cooking disaster.
meanings.sent4: The complicacy of the legal system can be compared to a tangled web.
meanings.sent5: The complicacy of the design left everyone in awe of its beauty.

meanings.definition: The presence of complicating factors or elements.
meanings.sent1: The complicacy of the issue made it difficult to reach a decision.
meanings.sent2: The complicacy of the project increased as more challenges arose.
meanings.sent3: The complicacy of the plan unexpectedly added a touch of excitement.
meanings.sent4: The complicacy of relationships can sometimes lead to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The complicacy of the problem demanded a creative solution.
